history.proof: intros n H. unfold is_factorisation. shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> {l : list (nat * nat) | is_factorisation n l}

Premises:
is_factorisation = fun (n : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)) => is_wf l /\ n = refactor l : nat -> list (nat * nat) -> Prop Arguments is_factorisation _%nat_scope _%list_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
factorisation : forall n : nat, {l : list (nat * nat) | is_wf l /\ n = refactor l} + {n = 0}
is_wf_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
is_wf_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail)
mult_lemma3 : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m > 1 -> n < n * m
is_pwd_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> P tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> P l
is_pwd_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> P tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> P l
prime_power_divides_refactor : forall (p n m : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf l -> divides (refactor l) (power p n) -> In (p, m) l -> n <= m
nat_factor_prime : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> n <> 1 -> {p : nat & {m : nat & {q : nat | is_prime p /\ m > 0 /\ n = power p m * q /\ is_gcd 1 p q /\ q < n}}}
mult_lemma6 : forall a b n : nat, n <> 0 -> n * a = n * b -> a = b
Inductive is_pwd : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_pwd : is_pwd nil | cons_is_pwd : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> is_pwd ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_pwd _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_pwd (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope _ _%function_scope
nat_factor : forall n p : nat, is_prime p -> n <> 0 -> {m : nat | divides n (power p m) /\ ~ divides n (power p (m + 1))}
in_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf l -> is_prime p /\ n > 0
pwd_impl_set : forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> is_set (nat * nat) l
cons_is_pwd : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> is_pwd ((p, n) :: tail)
refactor = fix refactor (l : list (nat * nat)) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | (p, n) :: tail => power p n * refactor tail end : list (nat * nat) -> nat Arguments refactor _%list_scope
factorisation_unique_upto_perm : forall l l' : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> is_wf l' -> refactor l = refactor l' -> is_permutation (nat * nat) l l'
remainder_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
quotient_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
destruct_list : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), {x : A & {tl : list A | l = x :: tl}} + {l = nil}
prime_divides_refactor : forall (p : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> is_wf l -> divides (refactor l) p -> exists m : nat, In (p, m) l
euclide : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | a = b * q + r /\ r < b}}
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
factor_divides_refactor : forall (x : nat * nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), In x l -> divides (refactor l) (power (fst x) (snd x))
factorisation_unique_upto_equiv_aux : forall l l' : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> is_wf l' -> refactor l = refactor l' -> forall x n : nat, In (x, n) l -> In (x, n) l'
rel_prime_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n q m : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf ((q, m) :: l) -> rel_prime p q
power_divides_lemma1 : forall n x : nat, 0 < n -> divides (power x n) x
Nat.add_0_r : forall n : nat, n + 0 = n
Nat.sub_diag : forall n : nat, n - n = 0
minus_n_O : forall n : nat, n = n - 0
Nat.sub_0_r : forall n : nat, n - 0 = n
power_rel_prime : forall d a n : nat, n > 0 -> rel_prime a (power d n) -> rel_prime a d
wf_impl_pwd : forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> is_pwd l
lt_wf_rec : forall (n : nat) (P : nat -> Set), (forall n0 : nat, (forall m : nat, m < n0 -> P m) -> P n0) -> P n
Zne_left : forall n m : Z, Zne n m -> Zne (n + - m) 0
not_prime_impl_prime_divides : forall n : nat, ~ is_prime n -> {p : nat | is_prime p /\ divides n p} + {n = 1}
Nat.eq_dec : forall n m : nat, {n = m} + {n <> m}
not_prime_zero = fun H : 0 <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides 0 d -> d = 1 \/ d = 0) => and_ind (fun (_ : 0 <> 1) (H1 : forall d : nat, divides 0 d -> d = 1 \/ d = 0) => match H1 2 (zero_max_div 2) with | or_introl H2 => let H3 : False := eq_ind 2 (fun e : nat => match e with | S (S _) => True | _ => False end) I 1 H2 in False_ind False H3 | or_intror H2 => let H3 : False := eq_ind 2 (fun e : nat => match e with | 0 => False | S _ => True end) I 0 H2 in False_ind False H3 end) H : ~ is_prime 0
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => 0%Z | S n0 => Z.pos (Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope

``` 
intros n H.
unfold is_factorisation.
exists [(n, 1)].
split.
- apply cons_is_wf.
  + apply is_prime_nat.
  + lia.
  + apply nil_is_wf.
  + apply is_rel_prime_refactor.
- reflexivity.
```
